abstract: Oracle said Friday it had bid $17 a share to acquire BEA Systems, a business-software maker that Carl Icahn has been urging to sell itself. In a news release, Oracle said its bid was “the culmination of repeated conversations with BEA’s management over the last several years,” adding that “we look forward to completing a friendly transaction as soon as possible.”
